page.title: 10SOUTH END SCHOOL-POST WAR
page.content: In March 1942 it was decided that the area beneath the school was ideal for the making of meals for the children. At first 142 meals were prepared. The older boys took over allotments to grow vegetables for the kitchen. The kitchen was so successful that by September it was extended to provide almost 200 container meals for surrounding schools. In January 1953 the infants moved to a new building at Cross Lane. The Infants Department being taken by the Girls School. In 1958 Elland Grammar School became Brooksbank Comprehensive School at which time the children over 11 years old were transferred unless they were in their final years in which case they stayed at South End until they finally left.
